title: The influential work of H.L.J. Vanstiphout provides a useful overview of generic analyses of Mesopotamian literature. From his ‘trail-blazing’ paper from 1986, Vanstiphout has built an oeuvre demonstrating the plausibility of fitting styles of Mesopotamian literature into ‘genres,’ although these genres are still a source of scholarly debate. See notably H.L.J. Vanstiphout, ‘Some Thoughts on Genre in Mesopotamian Literature
